Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:45 PM  Defendant in custody.  State's inducement of 9/13/22 rejected by defendant; withdrawn by the State.  Defendant wishes to proceed to preliminary hearing.  Court allows the inducement withdrawal.
1)  City of Mtwc PD Detective Jarred Lecher is sworn and testifies.  Examination by Atty. Scarpelli.  Defendant identification.  Cross-examination by Atty. Turner.  
Argument by Atty. Scarpelli.  Argument by Atty. Turner.
Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it.  Defendant is bound over for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT - Information to be filed that mirrors Complaint.
Not Guilty Plea entered/received.
Further proceedings:   11/18/22, 8:30 a.m.

Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond.
Attorney Michael Turner is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county at a rate of $5.00 per month commencing 10-01-22.

Order for Prints.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 06-22-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 3 cts. 1st degree sexual assault of child, repeated acts of sexual assault of child, 2 counts exposing genitals, expose child to harmful materials, carry concealed weapon, possess non-scheduled drug and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-27-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $30,000.00 cash and $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with A.D.C. or any premises she may occupy, defendant is to have no contact with anyone under the age of 18, defendant must not use or possess any internet enabled devices with the exception of use while in the Manitowoc County Jail, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is not to possess any weapons.  Recognizance bail furnished.  Cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
